page.title: 17EDUCATION IN STOURBRIDGE
page.content: The Local Authority schools in Stourbridge offer places for children to attend 5 to 11 primary schools followed by 11 to 16 comprehensive co-educational secondary schools. Only three of the schools have a nursery unit. Sixth form{education}is offered by the two colleges and independent boys'{school}. King Edward VI College was granted a charter by the young king in 1552. It is still thriving, like the{College}of Technology and Art which draws its pupils from all over the British Isles. There are also two private schools. Elmfield is modelled on the theories of Rudolf Steiner and accepts children aged 3 to 17. Oldswinford Hospital was founded in 1667 for poor apprentices to gain technical training. Today it caters for 70 boarders and 25 day boys annually.
